page.title: 09COMPUTERS ON THE FARM (1)
page.content: There are two{innovations}recently installed in a local farm which both have the same aim...to save labour and control the growth rates of cattle.One concerns cows. Each cow wears a{ {TRANSPONDER}round its neck, which links it up with a computer and allows food to come down the{HOPPER.}Each cow is fed on a 24 hour bases.Each hour 1/24 of the feed for one day is available for the cow.If the cow eats very little or none of this food then it automatically becomes an{ALARM COW. After the 24 hour period,the computer provides the imformation about each cow to the farmer.He gets the cow's transponder number,the daily amount of food taken that day,the daily amount of food allowed and a list of the "ALARM COWS".
